simulationModelling

Class AOSimulationModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • simulationModelling.AOSimulationModel

  • public abstract class AOSimulationModel
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is extended to create a simulation model using the Activity Object World View.

    It includes the time advance algorithm (see runSimulation) and a number of methods for scheduling and unscheduling Behaviour objects. A simulation model is create by extending this Class to include the following components.

    Structural Components

    • Objects for implementing Entity Structures with scope Unary or Set
    • Attributes for implementing constants and parameters. Recommend that a separate class be setup to collect all constants and parameters (class ConstPar)
    • Entity structures are translated either to a user defined class or a Java provided class. For example, the ArrayList class provided in the Java JDK is convenient for representing queues as is the HashSet class convenient for representing groups.

    Behavioural Components

    • The initialization action is typically implemented as a separate class with the name Initialise
    • It is recommended to collect the output constructs in the class named Output
    • The OutputSequence Class is available for implementing Sample Sequences and Trajectory sequences. The OutputSequence Class contains methods for implementing most DSOVs, but additional methods may be required to implementing model specific operators.
    • Attributes in the Output class can be used for implementing SSOVs and DSOVs
    • User defined procedures are implemented as methods and should be collected in the class named UP
    • Random variate procedures are implemented as methods and should be collected in the class named RVP
    • Deterministic value procedures are implemented as methods and should be collected in the class named DVP
    • User defined procedures are implemented as methods and should be collected in the class named UP
    • Action and Activity Constructs are implemented using separate classes and should extend the class available in the ABSmodJ package.

    Additional requirements to setting up the Simulation Model:

    • Implement the testPreconditions method which is called by the method runSimulation for testing Activity preconditions and interruption preconditions (see testPreconditions). This method should also reschedule scheduled actions and scheduled activities. A method reschedule() is provided to support such rescheduling (also called bootstrapping).
    • A number of methods are available for scheduling and unscheduling Behaviour objects on the sbl (scheduled behaviour list).
    • Override the method implicitStopConditions if the simulation model observation interval terminates on a condition.

    The methods eventOccurred, showSBL, and showESBL are used for debugging purposes.

    Author:
    Gilbert Arbez

    • Method Detail

      • implicitStopCondition

        protected boolean implicitStopCondition()
        Override this method to return true when a condition in the model indicates the end of the simulation run (implicit stop condition).
        Returns:
        A boolean value which is true when a stop condition becomes true and false otherwise. The default return value is to always return false. Override the method to implement a stop condition.

      • eventOccured

        public void eventOccured()
        Override this method to complete tasks after the execution of the SCS (of terminating events and starting events) before the advance of time.

        The method is useful for:

        1. Implementing the update of Trajectory sequences. Values of attributes used in Trajectory sequences can be tested for changes, and if a change is detected, the trajectory sequence updated.
        2. Debugging the execution of the simulation model. It is possible to place debug code to display the state of the model before time is advanced (i.e. after the model has been updated by terminating events and starting events). For example is it possible to show the contents of the sbl (scheduled behaviour list) using showsbl().

      • testPreconditions

        protected abstract void testPreconditions(Behaviour beh)
        Implement this method to test preconditions and schedule Actions/Activities.
        • Reschedule scheduled activity and action objects (bootstrapping). The reference to the behaviour object that terminated is passed. This object should be check to see if it a ScheduledAction object (using the .class.instance) method). The method reschedule is available to support this processing. Simply call it at the beginning of the precondition method.
        • test all preconditions defined in activity classes (Conditional Activity, Sequel Activity, Extended Conditional Activity and Extended Sequel Activity and Extended Scheduled Activity). When a precondition of a Conditional Activity is true, an instance of the class is created, its method startingEvent is executed, and the object is scheduled using the scheduleBehaviour method or scheduleExtBehaviour.
        • The extended behaviour list is scanned to test extended activities on th elist for interruption preconditions that are true. If one is found to be true, then the method interruptionSCS is executed (typically the method contains a call to unscheduleBehaviour method that removes the notice from both the SBL and ESBL.
        • The verification of the preconditions can be adapted to the system. For example, the above tests can be repeated until no precondition or interruption precondition returns true.
        Parameters:
        beh - References behaviour object found in the SBNotice pulled off of the SBL. See the description of runSimulation().

      • initAOSimulModel

        public void initAOSimulModel(double startTime)
        For initialising the simulation model.
        Parameters:
        startTime - Start time of the observation interval - usually set to 0.

      • initAOSimulModel

        public void initAOSimulModel(double startTime,
                             double endTime)
        For initialising the simulation model.
        Parameters:
        startTime - Start of the observation interval - usually set to 0.
        endTime - Explicit left hand side of the observation interval. This parameter is used to insert a StopBehaviour notice in the SBL (scheduled behaviour list) to stop the simulation run at the specified endTime.

      • setTimef

        public void setTimef(double endTime)
        Sets/resets the end time of the simulation run. This method allows the possibility of continuing the simulation run after is has terminated. This way a warm-up period can be implemented (using the initial value of the endTime) and then resetting the left-hand side of the observation interval with setTimef (actually adds a new StopBehaviour notice in the SBL). This method calls addStopNotice.
        Parameters:
        endTime - Explicit left hand side of the observation interval. This parameter is used to insert a StopBehaviour notice in the SBL (scheduled behaviour list) to stop the simulation run at the specified endTime.

      • addStopNotice

        public void addStopNotice(double stopTime)
        Adds a Stop Schedule Behaviour Notice to the SBL. This method adds a Stop Behaviour Notice to the SBL. It is possible to add multiple notices to the SBL to implement warm up times or create pauses during the execution of the simulation model. It performs the same function as setTimef (actually is called by setTimef).
        Parameters:
        stopTime - Explicit left hand side of the observation interval. This parameter is used to insert a StopBehaviour notice in the SBL (scheduled behaviour list) to stop the simulation run at the specified endTime.

      • runSimulation

        public void runSimulation()
        Run the simulation. Implements the time advance algorithm using the scheduled behaviour list. The scheduled behaviour list contains a time-ordered list of schedule behaviour notices (see SBNotice). A notice contains a termination time (time stamp which reflects the time at which an activity terminates (or an scheduled action occurs) and a reference to a behaviour object (a scheduled action or activity object). The time advance algorithm is as follows:
        • 1) Get the notice at the top of the SBL and advance the simulation clock to the termination time of the notice. The behaviour object in the noticed is process as defined in the next points.
        • 2) If the behaviour object is a StopBehaviour object, the simulation run is terminated.
        • 3) If the behaviour object is a scheduled activity and the event scheduled is the starting event (eventSched == EventScheduled.StartingEvent), then its startingEvent() method is called, otherwise its terminatingEvent() method is called. In addition, if the behaviour object is an Extended behaviour object and its terminating event was scheduled, it is removed from the esbl.
        • 4) If the behaviour object is a scheduled sequel activith and the event scheduled is the starting event (eventSched == EventScheduled.StartingEvent), then its startingEvent() method is called, otherwise its terminatingEvent() method is called. In addition, if the behaviour object is an Extended behaviour object and its terminating event was scheduled, it is removed from the esbl.
        • 5) For other activity objects (conditional and sequel), its terminating event is called, and if it is an extended activity as well, it is removed from the extended behaviour list.
        • 6) If the behaviour object is a scheduled action or a scheduled sequel action, then its actionEvent() method is called.
        • 7) Call the method testPreconditions() to test activity/action preconditions. The reference the behaviour object from the notice pulled from the SBL is passed to the method, so that it may be rescheduled in the case of Scheduled activities or actions. The method needs to be overridden. The method reschedule is available to schedule the terminating event of a scheduled activity after the occurrence of its starting event and the starting event after the occurrence of its terminating event. Note that the instance variable eventSched indicates which event has just occurred.
        • 8) Calls the method eventOccured() which can be overridden to insert additional logic at this point. see eventOccured().
        • 9) Calls implicitStopCondition() and terminates if the method returns true. This method can be overridden to implement implicit stop conditions.

      • runSimulationUntilNotice

        public boolean runSimulationUntilNotice(SBNotice sbn)
        Runs the simulation until the referenced SBNotice is encountered. If a Stop Notice is Encountered, the run is terminated. The return value is true when the reference SBNotice is reached. Note that the SBNotice is not "executed"; it remains at the top of the SBL as the imminent notice.
        Parameters:
        sbn - The reference to the event notice on the SBL to which simulation is to be run.
        Returns:
        - set to true when the SBNotice is reached and false when at end of the simulation or an error occurred.

      • runSimulationEvent

        public boolean runSimulationEvent()
        Runs a single event of the simulation.
        Returns:
        - set to true when at end of the simulation or an error occurred, and false otherwise.

      • scheduleSequel

        public void scheduleSequel(double schedTime,
                           Behaviour behObj)
        This method can be used to schedule a Scheduled sequel activity or action.

        The schedule time must be provided to schedule the behaviour object. For Activities checks that the starting event is being scheduled. The starting event will occur at the given schedule time.

        Parameters:
        schedTime - Event time of scheduled sequel activity or action.
        behObj - Reference to an object whose class is a subclass of ScheduledSequelAction or ScheduledSequelActivity.

      • scheduleAction

        public void scheduleAction(ScheduledAction action)
        This method can be used to schedule a Scheduled action.

        It will determine the time at which the action occurs using its timeSequence() method which should provide the time at which the action is next scheduled. Please note that it does not execute the startingEvent() method.

        Parameters:
        action - Reference to an object whose class is a subclass of ScheduledAction.

      • scheduleActivity

        public void scheduleActivity(Activity activity)
        This method can be used to schedule an activity Steps taken by the method depends on the type of activity.
        • Scheduled Activity: if the eventSched of the activity is EventScheduled.StartingActivity then the starting event is scheduled. The timeSequence() method is used to determine the time of scheduling. Otherwise the value given by a call to duration() is added to the current time to determine the time to schedule the activity. If the activity is also an extended activity and the terminating event is being scheduled, then the SBNotice referencing the activity is also placed on the esbl.
        • Conditional and Sequel Activities: the value given by a call to duration() is added to the current time to determine the time to schedule the activity.
        • Extended Activities: If any of the activity objects are extended activities, then the activity object is added to the extended scheduled behaviour list (esbl)

        Please note that it does not execute the startingEvent() nor the terminatingEvent() method.

        Parameters:
        activity - Reference to an object whose class is a subclass of Activity, that is, one of ConditionalActivity or SequelActivity or ScheduledActivity or any of the extended activities.

      • reschedule

        public void reschedule(Behaviour behObj)
        This method can be used to reschedule a Scheduled action or Scheduled Activity. It will also schedule the terminating event of the Scheduled Sequel Activity.

        It will determine the time at which the action or activity occurs using its timeSequence() method which should provide the time at which the action is next scheduled.

        In the case of the Scheduled Activity the activity the only if eventSched is set to EventScheduled.TerminatingEvent. In this case eventSched is set to EventScheduled.TerminatingEvent and the activity rescheduled by a call to scheduleActivity. If the timeSequence() method returns a negative value, then the action/activity is not rescheduled.

        Parameters:
        behObj - Reference to an object whose class is a subclass of Behaviour. Only if the object is an instance of either ScheduledAction or Scheduled Activity will the object be rescheduled. All other objects are simply ignored.

      • unscheduleBehaviour

        public SBNotice unscheduleBehaviour(Behaviour beh)
        Can be used to remove a behaviour object from the SBL/ESBL.
        Parameters:
        beh - A reference to the behaviour object to be removed from the behaviour lists.
        Returns:
        Returns a reference to the scheduled behaviour notice (SBNotice) object if the behaviour object is found on the sbl. If not found, null is returned.

      • unscheduleBehaviour

        public void unscheduleBehaviour(SBNotice nt)
        Can be used to remove a scheduled behaviour notice object from the SBL/ESBL.
        Parameters:
        nt - A reference to the scheduled behaviour notice (SBNotice) object to be removed from the behaviour lists.

      • showSBL

        public void showSBL()
        Shows the contents of the SBL - useful for debugging. Provides a method to list the contents of the SBL by listing termination times and Class names of the behaviour object found in the scheduled behaviour notices. The list is presented in sequence of termination times.

      • showESBL

        public void showESBL()
        Shows the contents of the ESBL - useful for debugging. Provides a method to list the contents of the ESBL by listing termination times and Class names of the behaviour object found in the scheduled behaviour notices. If the "name" attribute of the behaviourInstances references a string, it is included in the log output of the scheduled behaviour object.

      • getStopNoticeCount

        public int getStopNoticeCount()
        Gets the number of Stop Notices on the SBL.
        Returns:
        Returns the current value of the simulated clock.

      • getClock

        public double getClock()
        Get the current time (value of simulated clock).
        Returns:
        Returns the current value of the simulated clock.

      • getTime0

        public double getTime0()
        Provides the time of the left hand side of the observation interval t0.

        Usually set to 0.

        Returns:
        The time of the left hand side of the observation interval.

      • getTimef

        public double getTimef()
        This is the time of the right hand side of the observation interval.

        This value is set at the end of the simulation run.

        Returns:
        The time of the right hand side of the observation interval.

      • getCopySBL

        public java.util.PriorityQueue<SBNotice> getCopySBL()

      • getCopyESBL

        public java.util.ArrayList<SBNotice> getCopyESBL()
        Shows the contents of the ESBL - useful for debugging.

        Provides a method to list the contents of the ESBL by listing termination times and Class names of the behaviour object found in the extended scheduled behaviour notices.

        Returns:
        A reference to a copy of the extended scheduled behaviour list (array of SBNotice objects).

      • containsImplicitStopCondition

        public java.lang.Boolean containsImplicitStopCondition()
        Checks if the SimulationModel has an implicit stop condition.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the method implicitStopCondition has been overridden.
